newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Denmark defies China warning on rights resolution.
newsitem.headline: Denmark defies China warning on rights resolution.

text.p: Foreign Minister Niels Helveg Petersen said on Monday Denmark would press ahead with a U.N. resolution criticising China's human rights record despite China warning it would severely damage relations.
"We have made our decision," Petersen told the Danish Ritzaus news agency.
Denmark's decision ignored warnings earlier on Monday from Beijing where Foreign Ministry spokesman Shen Guofang said: "If Denmark insists on doing this it will end up as the biggest loser."

The Netherlands, which currently holds the rotating EU presidency, has been trying without success to persuade the 15- nation bloc to join forces and sponsor a resolution criticising China at the Geneva meeting of the United Nations human rights commission.
Although most members support the move, France blocked the resolution and has instead called for dialogue with China rather than confrontation.
Dutch Foreign Minister Hans van Mierlo has said the Netherlands would support the Danish resolution outside of the EU.
